citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The program of veterinary care does not address the avian species ( chicken ,ducks and geese ) at this facility . The
program of veterinary care must be updated to include avian species at this facility to ensure adequate veterinary care is
provided.
CORRECT BY : 11/10/23

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
A plan for environmental enrichment has not yet been developed for the avian species ( chicken , ducks and geese ) at
this facility . Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for
environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the
attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and with currently accepted
professional standards.
CORRECT BY : 11/10/23

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
There is a build up of manure and debris on the ground in the enclosure housing the chickens , ducks and geese . and
also present under the enclosure housing the juvenile ducks. There is food and debris on the walls of the enclosure
housing the juvenile ducks. A build up of manure and old food is an attractant for flies and other pests and can lead to
health issues for the poultry . Excreta and food waste must be removed from primary enclosures and from under and
around primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent excessive accumulation of feces and food waste, to prevent
soiling of the birds contained in the primary enclosures, and to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests, and odors.
CORRECT BY : 10/14/23
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n
